messages.subject: Re: multiplying
messages.msgSnippet: My dad is a retired biology teacher and a creationist.  He hands down all his Ex Nihilo magazines to me.  I always have my hands on good creation literature to
messages.messageBody:
My dad is a retired biology teacher and a creationist. He hands down
all his Ex Nihilo magazines to me. I always have my hands on good
creation literature to enjoy.

The Bible doesn't come right out and explain genetic mutations, but
it does say that Adam and Eve were created perfect. We do know that
death and decay of the human body happened only as a result of Eve's
sin.

I know what you mean about not getting good answers about Bible
questions. Some people just seem to not want to really think things
through or ever consider anything that would allow anyone to label
them heretical.

Sheila


> <<The reason why brothers and sisters shouldn't have children
together
> now is because they are so closely genetically related and therefore
> more likely to have the same genetic mutations which leads to an
> increased chance of defects.
>
> Adam and Eve, however, were created perfect. Perfect bodies, no
> genetic mutations at all. It took several generations for genetic
> mutations to be a problem. Therefore, Adam's children could marry
> and have children with each other with no chance of birth defects.
> There was no God-given law to not sleep with brothers and sisters
> until later on.>>
>
>
> Thank you for the answer and I'm following so far. Now another
question. How
> do you know this about the explanation you gave me? Is it written
in the
> bible that this is the case or something someone taught you? And
again,
> thanks for the explanation. I've been to private catholic schools
all my
> life and whenever my doubtful questions were asked, I never got any
answer
> that seemed logical to me other than because that's the way it was.
Any
> chance I can ask some other things that I've wondered about in
regard to the
> bible without a war?
>
> Mary B
>
>
> _________________________________________________________________
> Chat with friends online, try MSN Messenger:
http://messenger.msn.com

messages.subject: Re: multiplying
messages.msgSnippet: There were lots of cousins reproducing together in the history of the world.  Didn t it happen with wealthy/prestigious families in the early U.S. who only
messages.messageBody:
There were lots of cousins reproducing together in the history of the
world. Didn't it happen with wealthy/prestigious families in the
early U.S. who only wanted their kids to marry someone "proper" (ie,
someone from their own family)?

Sheila

> And then... the world was repeopled from Noah and his sons and
their wives.
>
> Cousins again.

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: multiplying
messages.messageBody:
>From: "kayb85" <sheran@...>

<<The reason why brothers and sisters shouldn't have children together
now is because they are so closely genetically related and therefore
more likely to have the same genetic mutations which leads to an
increased chance of defects.

Adam and Eve, however, were created perfect. Perfect bodies, no
genetic mutations at all. It took several generations for genetic
mutations to be a problem. Therefore, Adam's children could marry
and have children with each other with no chance of birth defects.
There was no God-given law to not sleep with brothers and sisters
until later on.>>


Thank you for the answer and I'm following so far. Now another question. How
do you know this about the explanation you gave me? Is it written in the
bible that this is the case or something someone taught you? And again,
thanks for the explanation. I've been to private catholic schools all my
life and whenever my doubtful questions were asked, I never got any answer
that seemed logical to me other than because that's the way it was. Any
chance I can ask some other things that I've wondered about in regard to the
bible without a war?

Mary B

<< Adam and Eve, however, were created perfect. Perfect bodies, no
genetic mutations at all. It took several generations for genetic
mutations to be a problem. Therefore, Adam's children could marry
and have children with each other with no chance of birth defects.
There was no God-given law to not sleep with brothers and sisters
until later on.
>>

And then... the world was repeopled from Noah and his sons and their wives.

Cousins again.

messages.subject: Re: multiplying
messages.msgSnippet: The reason why brothers and sisters shouldn t have children together now is because they are so closely genetically related and therefore more likely to have
messages.messageBody:
The reason why brothers and sisters shouldn't have children together
now is because they are so closely genetically related and therefore
more likely to have the same genetic mutations which leads to an
increased chance of defects.

Adam and Eve, however, were created perfect. Perfect bodies, no
genetic mutations at all. It took several generations for genetic
mutations to be a problem. Therefore, Adam's children could marry
and have children with each other with no chance of birth defects.
There was no God-given law to not sleep with brothers and sisters
until later on.


Sheila

> Something I've always wondered about but never asked. Hopefully
this won't
> cause trouble. For those who believe in the Bible, how does one
explain Adam
> and Eve having children and then where did the other children come
from. All
> of Adam and Eve's kids? Multiplying among brothers and sister?
>
> Mary B
>
>

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: multiplying
messages.messageBody:
>From: "kayb85" <sheran@...>

<<"So God created man in his own image, in the image of GOd He created
him; male and female He created them. God blessed them and said to
them, "Be fruitful and increase in number; fill the earth and subdue
it. Rule over the fish of the sea and the birds of the air and over
every living creature that moves on the ground.">>


Something I've always wondered about but never asked. Hopefully this won't
cause trouble. For those who believe in the Bible, how does one explain Adam
and Eve having children and then where did the other children come from. All
of Adam and Eve's kids? Multiplying among brothers and sister?

Mary B

messages.subject: Re: multiplying
messages.msgSnippet: How about Gen 1:27-28? So God created man in his own image, in the image of GOd He created him; male and female He created them.  God blessed them and said to
messages.messageBody:
How about Gen 1:27-28?

"So God created man in his own image, in the image of GOd He created
him; male and female He created them. God blessed them and said to
them, "Be fruitful and increase in number; fill the earth and subdue
it. Rule over the fish of the sea and the birds of the air and over
every living creature that moves on the ground."

Having said that, I won't say that means that we today have a
commandment to be fruitful and increase in number, otherwise every
infertile couple would be breaking a commandment. I believe that
commandment was to Adam and Eve specifically. I do, however, believe
that the general attitude of the Bible is that children are to be
treasured, that they're wonderful blessings from God, and that we
should enjoy them and desire to have them.
Sheila

multiply, and

Be

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] multiplying
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/4/02 9:20:12 AM, lisa-hardiman@attbi.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/4/02 9:20:12 AM, lisa-hardiman@... writes:

<< The Bible also says to replenish the earth. Does having a bunch of kids
in a world being destroyed by human activity following a law? >>

Show us the law before we argue about the "law."

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] multiplying
messages.msgSnippet: God told birds and animals to multiply, and he told Noah and his sons to.  I don t think he told anyone else to. (GENES 1:21)  And God created great whales,
messages.messageBody:
God told birds and animals to multiply, and he told Noah and his sons to. I
don't think he told anyone else to.

(GENES 1:21) And God created great whales, and every living creature that

moveth, which the waters brought forth abundantly, after their

kind, and every winged fowl after his kind: and God saw that

it was good.

(GENES 1:22) And God blessed them, saying, Be fruitful, and multiply, and

fill the waters in the seas, and let fowl multiply in the

earth.


(GENES 9:1) And God blessed Noah and his sons, and said unto them, Be
fruitful, and multiply, and replenish the earth.

messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] multiplying
messages.msgSnippet: The Bible also says to replenish the earth.  Does having a bunch of kids in a world being destroyed by human activity following a law?  Lisa of MT ... From:
messages.messageBody:
The Bible also says to replenish the earth. Does having a bunch of kids
in a world being destroyed by human activity following a law? Lisa of
MT

-----Original Message-----
From: starsuncloud@... [mailto:starsuncloud@...]
Sent: Friday, October 04, 2002 7:09 AM
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] multiplying

In a message dated 10/4/02 2:40:30 AM Central Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< even Christian families that are supposed to follow God's laws to
multiply. >>

Law? I don't agree that there is any law to multiply. Those kind of
thoughts
are exactly why people who shouldn't have children end up having too
many.
It's something that should have a LOT more thought than most people put
into
it. Makes me sad when I hear someone obeying some law, instead of doing
what's right for their family.

Ren
